etymology.description: 匸(匸) (xì, "that which hides; that which stores") + 矢(矢) (shǐ, "arrow") = hidden arrow -> healing
etymology.interpretation: The character 医(醫) (yī, "medical") represents the concept of healing by depicting a hidden arrow. The idea is related to removing or addressing the harmful 'arrow' that might metaphorically cause illness, aligning with the role of a doctor to treat and heal.
etymology.simplification: The traditional form 醫(醫) retains related components, while 医 (yī, "medical") simplifies these using 匸(匸) to maintain the core semantic elements related to healing.

parts.english: that which hides; that which stores

examples.chinese: 他生病时(他生病時)，去看了医生(去看了醫生)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shēngbìng shí, qù kàn le yīshēng.
examples.english: When he got sick, he went to see a doctor.

examples.chinese: 她立志成为名医(她立志成為名醫)，帮助病人康复(幫助病人康復)。
examples.pinyin: Tā lìzhì chéngwéi míngyī, bāngzhù bìngrén kāngfù.
examples.english: She is determined to become a renowned doctor and help patients recover.
